metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5184 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
PDFium in Google Chrome prior to 54.0.2840.59 for Windows, Mac, and Linux;54.0.2840.85 for Android incorrectly handled object lifecycles inCFFL_FormFillter::KillFocusForAnnot, which allowed a remote attacker topotentially exploit heap corruption via crafted PDF files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-browser-l10n - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-chromedriver - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.3029.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1172').
